channel.title: JRE vs JDK
channel.description: Okay people, when downloading the latest Java, what is recommended, the newest Java Runtime Environment (JRE) or the Java Development Kit (JDK). I've been reading and some places are JDK and some JRE, please help me out.

item.title: JRE vs JDK
item.dc:creator: @axlfink axlfink
item.description:
@axlfink wrote:

Some one give me link to jdk 6.0

Read full topic

item.title: JRE vs JDK
item.dc:creator: @Nova_Warlock Nova Warlock
item.description:
@Nova_Warlock wrote:

I just want to play MoparScape…not chnge anything lol

Read full topic

item.title: JRE vs JDK
item.dc:creator: @Alpha_X Alpha X
item.description:
@Alpha_X wrote:

You only need jdk for editing the code. And you will need to set your paths. Just reply here when you finished so we can advance to the next step.

Read full topic

item.title: JRE vs JDK
item.dc:creator: @Nova_Warlock Nova Warlock
item.description:
@Nova_Warlock wrote:

Well, right now I’m downloading the first one which is:

Java SE Development Kit (JDK) 6 (11.Dec.06)
The Java SE Development Kit (JDK) includes the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) and command-line development tools, such as compilers and debuggers, that are necessary or useful for developing applets and applications.

And as you read you see that its says Quote The Java SE Development Kit (JDK) includes the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) *Quote

It includes the JRE, should that be enough to run the client online and offline?

Read full topic

item.title: JRE vs JDK
item.dc:creator: @Alpha_X Alpha X
item.description:
@Alpha_X wrote:

You need both JDK and JRE.

JRE:
It lets you run java applications

JDK:
It lets you compile your java source code.

Read full topic

item.title: JRE vs JDK
item.dc:creator: @tim_moughtin tim_moughtin
item.description:
@tim_moughtin wrote:

Nova Warlock:

I’m thinking of downloading the first one seeing as it has the JRE in it too? Might that be a good plan? Or doesn’t it still matter? Cause if it don’t matter, I’m just going to download the smallest (dial up blows).

go for smallest, the others are filled with junk youwill never use.

Read full topic

item.title: JRE vs JDK
item.dc:creator: @tim_moughtin tim_moughtin
item.description:
@tim_moughtin wrote:

[quote=“Nova Warlock, post:5, topic:108549”]I’m looking at 2 JDK downloads, I’ll post names and info:

Java SE Development Kit (JDK) 6 (11.Dec.06)
The Java SE Development Kit (JDK) includes the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) and command-line development tools, such as compilers and debuggers, that are necessary or useful for developing applets and applications.

Java SE Development Kit (JDK) 6 with Java EE (14.Dec.06)
This distribution of the Java SE Development Kit (JDK) includes the Enterprise Edition (Java EE), which provides web services, component-model, management, and communications APIs that make it the industry standard for implementing enterprise-class service-oriented architecture (SOA) and Web 2.0 applications.

[shadow=red,left]Which one should I choose?[/shadow][/quote]

doesnt matter

Read full topic

item.description:

I’m looking at 2 JDK downloads, I’ll post names and info:

Java SE Development Kit (JDK) 6 (11.Dec.06)
The Java SE Development Kit (JDK) includes the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) and command-line development tools, such as compilers and debuggers, that are necessary or useful for developing applets and applications.

Java SE Development Kit (JDK) 6 with Java EE (14.Dec.06)
This distribution of the Java SE Development Kit (JDK) includes the Enterprise Edition (Java EE), which provides web services, component-model, management, and communications APIs that make it the industry standard for implementing enterprise-class service-oriented architecture (SOA) and Web 2.0 applications.

[shadow=red,left]Which one should I choose?[/shadow]
